data.title: Beverly Hills Warner Brothers Theatre
data.meta_description: Exterior view of the Warner Bros. Beverly Hills Theatre, at 9404 Wilshire Boulevard in Beverly Hills, in 1935. "Warner Bros. Theatre, the pride of Beverly Hills" is visible on the side of the building. The marquee features "Traveling saleslady" with Joan Blondell, and "Death flies easy" with Conrad Nagel. This structure was designed by B. Marcus Priteca and opened in 1931; it was demolished in 1988 and replaced with a parking lot.
